      • addToChat

        public java.lang.String addToChat(java.lang.String sender,
                         java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a message into the chat log, which is then returned to client for display. The server does the work of converting the arraylist into a string for the client. If the message entered is "clear", the chat is globally cleared.
        Specified by:
        addToChat in interface MemoryGameService

      • getChat

        public java.lang.String getChat()
        Retrieves the current chat log and turns into a string for display. This is used when the client updates the chat log, now while entering a new message.
        Specified by:
        getChat in interface MemoryGameService

      • joinLobby

        public boolean joinLobby(java.lang.String PlayerName)
        Join a pre-created game lobby before game if there is no game currently running and there is a lobby running. Also cannot join if there are already four players in the lobby. There is a secret command that will claer out the server. If you attempt to join with the name, "wipeserver", all current players with disconnect.
        Specified by:
        joinLobby in interface MemoryGameService

      • closeLobby

        public void closeLobby()
        Stop game lobby completely
        Specified by:
        closeLobby in interface MemoryGameService

      • doUnexpectedFailure

        protected void doUnexpectedFailure(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Override the default exception so the container can receive exceptions Note that the default RemoteServiceServlet implementation never throws exceptions to the servlet container. All exceptions that escape the RemoteServiceServlet.processCall(String) method will be caught, logged in the servlet context, and will cause a generic failure message to be sent to the GWT client -- with a 500 status code. To customize this behavior, override RemoteServiceServlet.doUnexpectedFailure(java.lang.Throwable).
